items.name: Clockwork Orange
items.author: Anthony Burgess
items.description: A Clockwork Orange is a dystopian satirical black comedy novel by English writer Anthony Burgess, published in 1962.

items.name: Death on the Nile
items.author: Agatha Christie
items.description: Death on the Nile is a work of detective fiction by British writer Agatha Christie, published in the UK by the Collins Crime Club.

items.name: Harry Potter And The Sorcerer'S Stone
items.author: J.K. Rowling
items.description: Harry Potter has no idea how famous he is. That's because he's being raised by his miserable aunt and uncle who are terrified Harry will learn that he's really a wizard, just as his parents were.

items.name: Hobbit
items.author: J. R. R. Tolkien
items.description: The unwilling hero of The Hobbit, Bilbo Baggins, is persuaded to join Thorin and his 12 dwarfs to recover their stolen treasure, which is being guarded by the dragon Smaug.

items.name: The Alchemist
items.author: Paulo Coelho
items.description: The Alchemist is a classic novel in which a boy named Santiago embarks on a journey seeking treasure in the Egyptian pyramids.

items.name: Better Homes & Gardens
items.author: Stephen Orr
items.description: Better Homes & Gardens is your go-to destination for home decor advice, DIY projects, gardening, cleaning tips, and recipes.

items.name: Bon App√©tit
items.author: Dawn Davis
items.description: Cook with confidence. Enjoy your food. Find recipes, search our encyclopedia of cooking tips and ingredients.

items.name: Rolling Stone
items.author: Jason Fine
items.description: Rolling Stone is a monthly American magazine focused on popular culture.

items.name: National Geographic
items.author: Susan Goldberg
items.description: Monthly magazine of geography, archaeology, anthropology, and exploration.

items.name: Time
items.author: Susan Goldberg
items.description: An American news magazine and news website published and based in New York City. For nearly a century, it was published.

items.name: Financial Times
items.author: Roula Khalaf
items.description: An international British business newspaper. It is a newspaper published in London. Periodically 24 places.

items.name: New York Times
items.author: Joe Kahn
items.description: The New York Times is an American daily newspaper founded on September 18, 1851 and printed in New York City.

items.name: The Guardian
items.author: George Harrison
items.description: The Guardian is a British daily newspaper. It was founded in 1821 by the Scott Trust as The Manchester Guardian.

items.name: The Times
items.author: Alice Hope
items.description: The Times is a British newspaper founded in 1785. It has been coming out under this name since 1788.

items.name: Washington Post
items.author: Alice Cooper
items.description: The Washington Post is the largest and oldest newspaper in Washington, the capital of the United States.

categories.description: Books: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet!
